Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "[ReleasePrep][2022.06.06]RI of dev into main" (#9136) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Merged pull request "Remove the trailing slash when formatting the tab fragment" (#9138) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
The search result may point to a URL like this:
https://dev.nugettest.org/packages/Newtonsoft.Json/

The existing approach appends the tab fragment like this:
https://dev.nugettest.org/packages/Newtonsoft.Json/#versions-body-tab

This is to remove the trailing slash when formatting the tab fragment:
https://dev.nugettest.org/packages/Newtonsoft.Json#versions-body-tab

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[Feature]: Nuget.Config search path and indication of what nuget.config was used" (#11868) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
### NuGet Product(s) Involved

NuGet.exe

### The Elevator Pitch

Know what nuget.config files are found and which ones is updated/read bu a command.
 I ran a nuget command to add a source but it didn't seem to work. Later I discovered the machine I was on had Nuget.Config files littered all over the place and a different one had been changed. It would be nice to have
1) Commands tell you which nuget.config they used, maybe only in '-Verbosity detailed'
2) A way to list all Nuget.Config files found in the search path in the order they are found
3) A way to output the search path, currently you have to search around and even then the info you find may be out of date or wrong.

### Additional Context and Details

_No response_

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Extra allocations in EqualityComparer" (#11867) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
The allocations performed by `EqualityComparer.OrderedEquals` and `EqualityComparer.SequenceEqualWithNullCheck` can be reduced by adding overloads that take lists and collections, potentially bypassing the calls to `OrderBy` and `SequenceEqual`.

In testing OrchardCore and [SanitisedNet471](https://github.com/NuGet/Home/issues/10030#issue-701185886), I saw a reduction of ~10% across both objects and total size.

### OrchardCore

¬† | Objects (millions) | Total Size (GB) | Objects % | Total Size %
-- | -- | -- | -- | --
Before (cd24c74) | 26.82 | 1.47 | N/A | N/A
After | 23.33 | 1.29 | 86.99% | 87.76%

### SanitisedNet471

¬† | Objects (millions) | Total Size (GB) | Objects % | Total Size %
-- | -- | -- | -- | --
Before (cd24c74) | 59.04 | 3.07 | N/A¬†| N/A
After | 53.55 | 2.80 | 90.70% | 91.21%

Other improvements in this area:

- `SetEqualsWithNullCheck` and `DictionaryEquals` can return early if both collections are empty.
- In `RestoreCommand.AddInputsFromDependencyGraphSpec`, `entryPointProjects` should be a `HashSet`, not a `List`.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[Bug]: Boxing of structs to compute hashcode is causing excessive allocations" (#11866) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
### NuGet Product Used

Other/NA

### Product Version

All

### Worked before?

_No response_

### Impact

Other

### Repro Steps & Context

The HashCodeCombiner takes an object parameter in its AddObject method and when passed a value type such as a struct or enum value, it boxes it to do a null check and then compute the hashcode.  This allocates boxed objects that are short-lived and not necessary.

After the fix for #11669, this becomes one of the top sources of allocation for NuGet restore for some scenarios.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/9663797/173164555-172a9db5-4b18-45bf-b36a-e471e698eada.png)

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/9663797/173164645-456c77b2-b2df-47d7-aef6-265ebadfaa75.png)
 

### Verbose Logs

_No response_

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "Create spec for package source mapping in VS options" (#11865) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody: This is the spec for the VS options portion of https://github.com/NuGet/Home/issues/11363

Events.RelatedDescription: Reopened issue "Validate that the package namespace syntax is correct" (#10783) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
Specifically, validate that the package namespace specified is `packageid` + `*` at the end. 
Also validate source key, package namespace are '', null, whitespace, whitespaces etc.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[Bug]: Double loading status indicators sometimes shown in PMUI" (#11864) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
### NuGet Product Used

Visual Studio Package Management UI

### Product Version

17.3.0 Preview 3.0 [32609.364.main]

### Worked before?

Yes, unknown

### Impact

It bothers me. A fix would be nice

### Repro Steps & Context

1. Create a new C# Class Library project.
2. Open PMUI for Solution.
3. On the Installed tab (opened by default, which may be important to repro), there are 2 indicators for "no packages found".
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/49205731/173136214-08404aea-17e8-4375-b14c-f3462cae0786.png)

Note that the visual tree shows multiple loading indicators:
![MicrosoftTeams-image (1)](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/49205731/173136349-37b701d3-c578-43b0-a4fe-4fc8957be63f.png)

One suspected cause is that recent changes to async loading logic and/or for grouping of the packages list could be allowing 2 additions of the `LoadingStatusIndicator` to the packages list.

### Verbose Logs

_No response_

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "When restore raises an NU1301, build might fail with a `project.assets.json doesn't have a target for 'net6.0-windows10.0.19041.0` like error that's a red herring" (#11862) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody: The real problem is that restore failed.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue ".nupkg.metadata locked and being used by another process" (#10882) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
## Details about Problem

We will occasionally see a log message when restoring a large solution (250+ projects, with many hundreds of nuget packages) where the restore fails because `.nupkg.metadata` is being used by another process. This occurs on our build server, running on Core 2019.

Currently all projects are net48, but we have recently started mixing in some netstandard libraries as well. Is there some possibility of conflict?

NuGet product used: nuget.exe

Product version: Microsoft (R) Build Engine version 16.9.0+5e4b48a27 for .NET Framework

Worked before? If so, with which NuGet version: We haven't seen this as a version dependent issue.

## Repro steps and/or sample project

Restore a large solution with many dependencies. We see this lock infrequently, but it will still fail our build maybe 1 in 20 times.

### Verbose Logs

```
build	19-May-2021 10:44:23	         The process cannot access the file 'E:\agt01\COM-CN-BAWAP\src\Bin\Packages\system.appcontext\4.3.0\.nupkg.metadata' because it is being used by another process.
```
